key_responsibilities: Review information received by OCE, discern possible violations, and identify facts requiring further investigation
Plan, organize and conduct investigations regarding allegations and advise the Staff Director and Chief Counsel regarding appropriate evaluation of cases
Advise the Staff Director and Chief Counsel on legal issues in matters under investigation and on broader legal and policy issues involved in the operations of OCE
Draft lengthy and detailed memoranda, reports, and referrals for Board consideration and potential public release
requirements: Demonstrated ability to conduct and direct complex legal research and present the results in a clear, precise and persuasive manner
Thoroughness and careful attention to detail
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong legal judgment and demonstrated professional integrity
Experience auditing large sets of data or evidence and providing detailed analysis
Ability to pass Security Background Investigation to obtain Top Secret clearance
Graduation from an ABA accredited law school and active bar membership

key_responsibilities: Support her work as a member of the House Appropriations Committee and as Co-Chair of the bipartisan Women, Peace, and Security Caucus

Encompass a wide range of foreign policy issues including covering the State and Foreign Operations Appropriations Subcommittee, Israel, homeland security, immigration, veterans, and other issues as assigned
requirements: Comfortable working in a fast-paced and team-oriented environment
Ability to build and maintain relationships
Previous experience on the Hill and with the Appropriations process

position: Press Secretary / Digital Director / Deputy Communications Director
key_responsibilities: Overseeing digital content for the member’s social media platforms and website
Drafting releases, newsletters, advisories, talking points, speeches, and more
requirements: Ability to be a self-starter and work on multiple projects at once in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: Responsible for important issues areas such as worker and family support, education, labor, transportation, among other issues
